result.execSummary:
The defendant Kyle L Kern was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
The defendant is to pay Fine of $10 + mandatory Court costs/fees totalling $265.60, Domestic Abuse Surcharge of $100 and DNA surcharge of $200 for a total balance due of $565.60
.
The defendant must pay the financial obligation within 90 days or set up a payment plan with the Clerk of Court office.  Failure to pay will result in a Judgment being entered and collected by WI State Debt Collections
.
